alert.note: Alert for Autauga; Chilton; Coosa; Elmore; Greene; Hale; Perry; Sumter (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 7:27PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Autauga, Elmore, Chilton, Perry, Greene, Hale, Sumter and Coosa Counties through 830 PM CDT... At 726 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southwest of Ashland to near Lay Lake to near Thorsby to 6 miles southwest of Panola. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Prattville, Alexander City, Millbrook, Calera, Clanton, Demopolis, Wetumpka, Tallassee, Marion, Livingston, Eutaw, Jemison, York, Greensboro, Uniontown, Goodwater, Rockford, Cuba, Kellyton and Weogufka. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for central, south central, southwestern, west central and east central Alabama.

area.areaDesc: Autauga; Chilton; Coosa; Elmore; Greene; Hale; Perry; Sumter
